meanings.definition: Full of or characterized by wrath; angry.
meanings.sent1: She was wrathy when she found out her brother had eaten all the cookies.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's wrathy expression made the students quiet down immediately.
meanings.sent3: The wrathy cat knocked over the vase in protest of being ignored.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in a wrathy mass, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: His wrathy tone sent shivers down her spine, signaling his anger.

meanings.definition: In a state of anger or fury.
meanings.sent1: The wrathy customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent2: After the argument, she was left feeling wrathy and frustrated.
meanings.sent3: The wrathy toddler threw a tantrum in the middle of the store.
meanings.sent4: The wrathy flames of the bonfire leaped high into the night sky.
meanings.sent5: His wrathy glare made it clear he was not to be trifled with.
